children.value: Used for data entry and verification. It supports input boxes, radio boxes, check boxes, file uploads, etc. It needs to be used in conjunction with the
represents a form item, and the validation rules are defined using the

props.code:
<z-form ref="formBasic" @submit="onSubmitBasic">
   <z-field
     v-model="username"
     name="username"
     label="username"
     placeholder="username"
     :rules="[{ required: true, message: 'Please fill in your username' }]"
   />
   <z-field
     v-model="password"
     type="password"
     name="password"
     label="password"
     placeholder="password"
     :rules="[{ required: true, message: 'Please fill in your password' }]"
   />
</z-form>
<view class="button">
   <z-button block type="primary" @click="submitFormBasic">
     submit
   </z-button>
</view>

children.value: "[{ required: true, message: 'Please fill in your username' }]"
"[{ required: true, message: 'Please fill in your password' }]"
. All available fields are shown in

props.code: submit

children.value: "[{ pattern, message: 'Please enter the correct content' }]"
"[{ validator, message: 'Please enter the correct content' }]"
"The verification function returns an error message"
"[{ validator: asyncValidator, message: 'Please enter the correct content' }]"

props.code:
<z-field name="checkbox" label="checkbox">
   <template #input>
     <z-checkbox v-model="checked" shape="square" />
   </template>
</z-field>
<z-field name="checkboxGroup" label="checkbox group">
   <template #input>
     <z-checkbox-group v-model="groupChecked" direction="horizontal">
       <z-checkbox name="1" shape="square">Checkbox 1</z-checkbox>
       <z-checkbox name="2" shape="square">Checkbox 2</z-checkbox>
     </z-checkbox-group>
   </template>
</z-field>

<z-field name="radio" label="radio button">
   <template #input>
     <z-radio-group v-model="checked" direction="horizontal">
       <z-radio name="1">Radio button 1</z-radio>
       <z-radio name="2">Radio button 2</z-radio>
     </z-radio-group>
   </template>
</z-field>

<z-field
   v-model="result"
   is-link
   readonly
   name="picker"
   label="selector"
   placeholder="Click to select city"
   @click="showPicker = true"
/>
<z-popup v-model:show="showPicker" position="bottom">
   <z-picker
     :columns="columns"
     @confirm="onConfirm"
     @cancel="showPicker = false"
   />
</z-popup>

<z-field
   v-model="result"
   is-link
   readonly
   name="datePicker"
   label="Time selection"
   placeholder="Click to select time"
   @click="showPicker = true"
/>
<z-popup v-model:show="showPicker" position="bottom">
   <z-date-picker @confirm="onConfirm" @cancel="showPicker = false" />
</z-popup>

children.value: Form item type - Province and city selector

props.code:
<z-field v-model="result"
   is-link
   readonly
   name="area"
   label="region selection"
   placeholder="Click to select province and city"
   @click="showArea = true"
/>
<z-popup v-model:show="showArea" position="bottom">
   <z-area
     :area-list="areaList"
     @confirm="onConfirm"
     @cancel="showArea = false"
   />
</z-popup>

<z-field
   v-model="result"
   is-link
   readonly
   name="calendar"
   label="calendar"
   placeholder="Click to select date"
   @click="showCalendar = true"
/>
<z-calendar v-model:show="showCalendar" @confirm="onConfirm" />

children.value: Form item label width, default unit is
Form item label alignment, optional values are
Input box alignment, optional values are
Error text alignment, optional values are
Form verification trigger timing, optional values ​​are
, supports setting multiple values ​​at the same time through arrays, specific usage is shown in the table below
Whether to add a colon after label
Whether to disable all input boxes in the form
Whether to set all input boxes in the form to read-only
Whether to display the form required asterisk
Whether to stop verification when a certain verification item fails
Whether to scroll to the wrong form item when the form is submitted and validation fails
Whether to mark the input box red when the verification fails
Whether to display an error message below the input box when the verification fails
Whether to submit the form when the enter key is pressed
For the API of form items, see:
Validation rules can be defined using the
attribute of Field. The optional attributes are as follows:
Whether it is a required field. When the value is a null value (empty string, empty array,
Error message copy, which can be set as a function to return dynamic copy content
Verify through functions, you can return a Promise for asynchronous verification
Verification is performed through regular expressions. If the regular expression cannot be matched, the verification fails
Set the triggering time of this rule. The priority is higher than the
attribute set by the Form component. The optional values are
Formatting function, converts the value of the form item and then verifies it
should be used to verify empty values. The default value is
The trigger timing of form validation can be customized through the
Validation is only triggered when the form is submitted
Trigger validation when the form is submitted and the input box is out of focus
Trigger verification when the form is submitted and the content of the input box changes
Triggered after the form is submitted and verification passes
Triggered after the form is submitted and verification fails
Through ref, you can get the Form instance and call instance methods.
Submit the form, which is equivalent to clicking the submit button
Get the current values of all form items
Validation form, supports passing in one or more
to validate single or partial form items. When
is not passed in, all form items will be verified
Reset the validation prompt of form items. It supports passing in one or more
to reset single or partial form items. If

Get the validation status of all form items, the status includes
